ctx: intros V HV T HT HSubst HLiftSubst2 k v t HclosedV HclosedT.
tactic: apply closed_subst_invariant with (k := S k) (v := v).
exceptions.exn: No such bound variable k (possible names are: k0, t0, j and v0).

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (V : Type) (H : Lift V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), LiftSubst2 -> forall (k : nat) (v : V) (t : T), closed k v -> closed (S k) t -> closed k (subst v 0 t)

Premises:

Build_LiftSubst : forall (V : Type) (H : Lift V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), (forall (t : T) (k : nat) (v : V) (s w : nat), lift w k (subst v s t) = subst (lift w k v) (lift w (1 + k) s) (lift w (shift s k) t)) -> LiftSubst
Build_LiftSubst1 : forall (V : Type) (H : Lift V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), (forall (t : T) (k : nat) (v : V) (s w : nat), k <= s -> lift w k (subst v s t) = subst (lift w k v) (w + s) (lift w k t)) -> LiftSubst1

Build_Pun2 : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T), (forall (t : T) (k : nat), subst (var k) k (shift (S k) t) = t) -> Pun2

closed_increment : LiftLift -> forall k t : nat, closed k t -> closed (1 + k) t

closed_monotonic : LiftLift -> forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> closed j t
lift_subst_2 : forall (t : ?T) (k : nat) (v : ?V) (s w : nat), s <= k -> lift w k (subst v s t) = subst (lift w k v) s (lift w (1 + k) t) where ?V : [ |- Type] ?H : [ |- Lift ?V] ?T : [ |- Type] ?H0 : [ |- Lift ?T] ?H1 : [ |- Subst ?V ?T] ?LiftSubst2 : [ |- LiftSubst2]

```coq
intros V HV T HT HSubst HLiftSubst2 k v t HclosedV HclosedT.
unfold closed in HclosedT.
rewrite <- HclosedT.
destruct HLiftSubst2 as [lift_subst_2].
apply closed_subst_invariant with (k := S k) (v := v).
- apply lift_preserves_closed.
  + assumption.
  + assumption.
- lia. 
Qed.
```

original: intros V HV T HT HSubst HLiftSubst2 k v t HclosedV HclosedT. unfold closed in HclosedT. rewrite <- HclosedT. destruct HLiftSubst2 as [lift_subst_2]. apply closed_subst_invariant with (k := S k) (v := v). - apply lift_preserves_closed. + auto. + auto. - lia.
